intro: Zamzela, commonly known as the African violet, is a tropical plant native to eastern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, often reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are known for their long-lasting beauty. Zamzela thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot.
